title: Visualize Openapi documents
body: ## Openapi Document Recent developments have been used in recent developments to generate an interface automatically by generating an Openapi file and passing it to the front end side when creating a RESTFUL API. Openapi files are output in YAML or JSON format, and are not suitable for humans in the same format, but can be used as documents by visualizing tools such as Swagger / Redoc. ## Swagger-UI ## Redoc ## How to Use In the case of GitLab, Swagger-UI is displayed just by placing the file name in the repository as `swagger.yml`. Reference: https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/openapi/openapi_interactive.html In the case of Redoc format, HTML files can be generated by listing as follows, so there is a use case that publishes the document by publishing it on GitLab / GitHub Pages after creating it with CI. `` `zsh $ redoc-cli bundle Openapi.yml `` ` Personally, Swagger-UI has more information on the screen than Redoc, and I feel that if you use it because the URL is easy to understand, it will be Swagger-UI. If you want to check the Swagger-UI / Redoc generated from the Openapi file, you can check it from the following tools. [Openapi Viewer | Kemu Tools] (https://portal.kemu.site/tools/openapi)
